rule: Finally, the output must include "General themes:" followed by a comma-separated list of general overarching themes that broadly capture the essence of the content in the provided text.
input: Text: The new era of digital currency, spearheaded by companies like Coinbase, is changing finance.
output:
Company names: Coinbase 
People names:  
Specific topics: digital currency, finance
General themes: technological disruption, innovation in financial services  




Let me know if you'd like me to analyze any other text!
complianceText:
The chatbot's output follows the format specified in the description. It extracts "Company names", "People names", "Specific topics", and "General themes" separately, each category labeled correctly. The extracted entities are presented as comma-separated lists, even when the list contains only one item. The categories without extracted entities (i.e., "People names") are left blank, maintaining consistency with the specified format.

There is no textual content outside of the format, except an additional closing statement "Let me know if you'd like me to analyze any other text!" However, this does not interfere with the structured output format described. The statement is separate and is not part of the entity extraction format.

No violation.
OK
